basic.floral_language:
Echeveria purpusorum
Floriography: joyful, unity, beautiful
Echeveria purpusorum has an elegant plant shape with hypertrophy leaves with tips and in gray green color and reddish-brown markings, leaves arranged in compact rosette, when sunny, leaf back and edge turn orange or red, like a blossoming lotus.
Echeveria purpusorum likes sunny places, dormant in winter under low temperature. May bloom on a long stem among leaves with orange bell-shaped flowers.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, orange red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color gray green, with red brown marks, with adequate light leaf edges turn to orange yellow to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Like sunshine, resistant to half shade, in a state of dormancy under low temperature in winter
maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, water every 7-10 days, water less frequently in winter dormancy
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring and summer
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
